description: Displays metrics collected by methods annotated with MicroProfile Fault Tolerance annotations

options.content:
This dashboard displays metrics collected by methods that are annotated with [MicroProfile Fault Tolerance](https://github.com/eclipse/microprofile-fault-tolerance/) annotations.

To use the dashboard for an Open Liberty application, you must be using at least [mpFaultTolerance-3.0](https://openliberty.io/docs/latest/reference/feature/mpFaultTolerance-3.0.html) which requires at least [mpMetrics-3.0](https://openliberty.io/docs/latest/reference/feature/mpMetrics-3.0.html).

If no methods are annotated with a given Fault Tolerance Strategy, e.g. @Retry, then the respective panels will display "No data". This differs from no methods __applying__ the strategy which would display 0 (or similar).

panels.description:
The percentage of method invocations (for methods annotated with @Fallback) which resulted in the Fallback method or handler being called over the past $avg_period.

If no methods are annotated with @Fallback "No data" will be displayed.
panels.title: Fallbacks [$avg_period]

panels.description:
The percentage of method invocations (for methods annotated with @Retry) which resulted in a Retry over the past $avg_period.

If no methods are annotated with @Retry "No data" will be displayed.
panels.title: Retries [$avg_period]

panels.description:
The percentage of method invocations (for methods annotated with @Timeout) which resulted in a Timeout over the past $avg_period.

If no methods are annotated with @Timeout "No data" will be displayed.
panels.title: Timeouts [$avg_period]

panels.description:
The percentage of method invocations (for methods annotated with @Bulkhead) which were rejected because the Bulkhead was full over the last $avg_period.

If no methods are annotated with @Bulkhead "No data" will be displayed.
panels.title: Bulkhead Rejections [$avg_period]

panels.description:
The percentage of method invocations (for methods annotated with @CircuitBreaker) which were rejected because the Circuit Breaker was open over the last $avg_period.

If no methods are annotated with @CircuitBreaker "No data" will be displayed.
panels.title: Circuit Breaker Rejects [$avg_period]

panels.description:
Percentage of calls which resulted in a failure.

This graph is showing failures after all Fault Tolerance processing has taken place (including Fallback).

If no methods annotated with Fault Tolerance are failing after the strategies have been applied "No data" will be displayed.

targets.expr:
topk(${topK}, 
sum without (result, fallback)(rate(ft_invocations_total{instance=~`${instance}`, result='exceptionThrown'}[$avg_period])) * 100 
/ 
sum without (result, fallback)(rate(ft_invocations_total{instance=~`${instance}`}[$avg_period])) 
) 
> 0

panels.title: Top $topK Most frequently failing methods over the last $avg_period

panels.description: Number of method invocations which occurred per second for methods
panels.title: Method invocations [per second, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Number of method invocations which occurred per second for methods
panels.title: Method invocations averaged over $instance instance(s)  [per second, avg $avg_period]

panels.description:
Percentage of calls which resulted in a failure.

This graph is showing failures after all Fault Tolerance processing has taken place (including Fallback)
panels.title: Failure rate [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description:
Percentage of calls which resulted in a failure.

This graph is showing failures after all Fault Tolerance processing has taken place (including Fallback)
panels.title: Failure rate averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocations which resulted in the Fallback method or handler being called over the past $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations triggering Fallback [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocations which resulted in the Fallback method or handler being called over the past $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations triggering Fallback averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocations which failed once the Fallback method or handler had been called
panels.title: Invocations failed after Fallback [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocations which failed once the Fallback method or handler had been called
panels.title: Invocations failed after Fallback averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocation which failed, despite applying Retry, over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations failed despite retries [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of method invocation which failed, despite applying Retry, over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations failed despite retries averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Average number of retries which occurred for each method invocation.
panels.title: Retries per invocation [avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Average number of retries which occurred for each method invocation.
panels.title: Retries per invocation averaged over $instance instance(s) [avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of invocations which timed out
panels.title: Invocations timed out [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of invocations which timed out
panels.title: Invocations timed out averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description:
Shows the selected quantile of execution times using a weighted average of the last 1000 executions.

The quantiles should be understood like this: if the 0.99 quantile is 300ms, then 99% of executions took less than 300ms. (Conversely, 1% of executions took longer than 300ms)
panels.title: Execution duration $quantile quantile for methods with a Timeout [s, avg 1000 exec.]

panels.description: The average duration a method with a Timeout executes for to return a value, using a weighted average of the last 1000 executions.
panels.title: Execution duration mean for methods with a Timeout [s, avg 1000 exec.]

panels.description: Percentage of calls which were rejected because the Bulkhead was full over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations rejected by Bulkhead [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of calls which were rejected because the Bulkhead was full over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations rejected by Bulkhead averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description:
Shows the selected quantile of execution times, for methods running with a Bulkhead, using a weighted average of the last 1000 executions.

The quantiles should be understood like this: if the 0.99 quantile is 300ms, then 99% of executions took less than 300ms. (Conversely, 1% of executions took longer than 300ms)
panels.title: Execution duration $quantile quantile for methods with a Bulkhead [s, avg 1000 exec.]

panels.description: The average duration a method with a Bulkhead runs for to return a value, using a weighted average of the last 1000 executions.
panels.title: Execution duration mean for methods with a Bulkhead [s, avg 1000 exec.]

panels.description:
Estimate of the number of concurrent calls that are attempted through the Bulkhead.

This is done by multiplying the number of attempted invocations by the mean execution time.
panels.title: Estimated number of attempted concurrent calls through a Bulkhead [avg 1m]

panels.description: Percentage of calls which were rejected because the Circuit Breaker was open over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations rejected by Circuit Breaker [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of calls which were rejected because the Bulkhead was open over the last $avg_period.
panels.title: Invocations rejected by Circuit Breaker averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of invocations which were permitted to run by the Circuit Breaker but failed.
panels.title: Circuit Breaker run but failed [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description: Percentage of invocations which were permitted to run by the Circuit Breaker but failed.
panels.title: Circuit Breaker run but failed averaged over $instance instance(s) [%, avg $avg_period]

panels.description:
Shows the percentage of time per-second that the Circuit Breaker spends in an Open or Half Open state.

The graph checks back for up to 1 minute for the two most recent data points.
panels.title: Circuit Breaker not closed [%]

yaxes.label: Percentage of time not closed per second

title: Open Liberty (mpFaultTolerance-3.x)
